meanings.definition: Capable of being removed by surgery.
meanings.sent1: The tumor was small and resectable, so the doctor recommended surgery.
meanings.sent2: The resectable appendix was causing the patient a lot of pain.
meanings.sent3: The resectable mole decided to pack its bags and leave the skin party.
meanings.sent4: Her resectable fear of public speaking was finally cut out by her newfound confidence.
meanings.sent5: The resectable stain on the carpet was easily removed with a bit of cleaning solution.

meanings.definition: Able to be excised or cut out.
meanings.sent1: The resectable portion of the fabric was neatly trimmed by the tailor.
meanings.sent2: The resectable cyst was causing discomfort and needed to be removed.
meanings.sent3: The resectable weed in the garden kept popping up no matter how many times it was cut out.
meanings.sent4: Her resectable bad habit of biting her nails was finally excised from her routine.
meanings.sent5: The resectable splinter in his finger was easily pulled out with tweezers.
